p: A compound obtained from the nutshell of Anacardium occidentale L., cardol triene (5-[(8 Z,11 Z)-pentadeca-8,11,14-trienyl]benzene-1,3-diol) is a phenolic lipid with three double bonds [ 176]. Cardol triene has been described as a potent mushroom tyrosinase inhibitor [ 177]. Additionally, cardol triene has antiparasitic activity against Schistosoma mansoni worms (IC 50: 192.6 ± 6.0 µM) [ 176] and against Trypanosoma cruzi amastigotes (11.75 ± 0.40 µM) and trypomastigotes (IC 50: 23.36 ± 0.12 µM) [ 178].
